feed.title: New attack identified and potential solution described: Dropped-transaction spam attack against the blocksize limit

entry.title: New attack identified and potential solution described: Dropped-transaction spam attack against the blocksize limit
entry.summary: In an email exchange from June 2015, Raystonn argued that without a blocksize limit, a spammer would flood the network with transactions until they ran out of money. However, the respondent pointed out that even without a blocksize limit, there is still a hard message size limit imposed by the p2p protocol, effectively limiting blocks to this size. The email thread also includes an attached HTML file that was scrubbed.
